sen.j: 石鏃（せきぞく）は石器の一種で、石製の鏃（やじり）、矢尻とも書く。
sen.e: Sekizoku is a type of stone tool also called a Yajiri (arrowhead is written in 2 different ways).
Sekizoku is a type of stone tool also called a Yajiri (arrowhead; 鏃 or 矢尻 in Chinese characters).
Sekizoku is a type of stone tool also called a Yajiri (arrowhead; 鏃 or 矢尻 in Chinese characters).

sen.j: 縄文時代に弓矢の使用とともに現れ、縄文・弥生時代時代において主に狩猟具として使われた。
sen.e: Sekizoku was developed as the usage of Yumiya (a bow and arrow) started in the Jomon Period and it was used during Jomon and Yayoi Periods mainly as a hunting tool.
Sekizoku was developed as the usage of Yumiya (a bow and arrow) started in the Jomon period and it was used during Jomon and Yayoi periods mainly as a hunting tool.
Sekizoku was developed as the usage of Yumiya (a bow and arrow) started in the Jomon period and it was used during Jomon and Yayoi periods mainly as a hunting tool.

sen.j: 石鏃を、底辺（基辺）の形状が直線になっているものを平基、くぼむものを凹基、突出するものを凸基の3種に分けられる。
sen.e: Sekizoku is classified into three structural types depending on the shape of he base (ki-hen); Hei-ki (Flat base), which had a straight base, 凹 base, which had a depression, and 凸 base, which had a projection.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sekizoku is classified into three structural types depending on the shape of ki-hen (the base); Hei-ki (flat base), which had a straight base, concave base, which had a depression, and convex base, which had a projection.

Sekizoku is classified into three structural types depending on the shape of ki-hen (the base); Hei-ki (flat base), which had a straight base, concave base, which had a depression, and convex base, which had a projection.

sen.j: 更に、茎（なかご）の有無で分けると、全体を平基（無茎）式、凹基（無茎）式、凸基無茎式、凸基有茎式の4形式に分類することができる。
sen.e: Sekizoku can be also classified into the following four types depending on the presence or absence of a stem (Nakago; a projection area); the flat base type (without the Nakago; Mukei), the 凹 base type (Mukei), the 凸 base type (Mukei), the 凸 base type (with the Nakago; Yukei).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sekizoku can be also classified into the following four types depending on the presence or absence of nakago (a stem; a projection area); the flat base type (without nakago), the concave base type (without nakago), the convex base type without nakago, the convex base type (with nakago).

Sekizoku can be also classified into the following four types depending on the presence or absence of nakago (a stem; a projection area); the flat base type (without nakago), the concave base type (without nakago), the convex base type without nakago, the convex base type (with nakago).

sen.j: 石鏃と同じような石器に、旧石器時代の尖頭器がある。
sen.e: Sentoki of the Paleolithic Period is similar to Sekizoku.
Sentoki (points) of the Paleolithic period is similar stone tool to Sekizoku.
Sentoki (points) of the Paleolithic period is similar stone tool to Sekizoku.

sen.j: 木葉形尖頭器が突槍 (lance) で、有舌尖頭器が投げ槍 (dart) である。
sen.e: Konohagata (a leaf-shap) Sentoki was used as a lance and Yuzetsu Sentoki was used as a dart.
Konohagata (a leaf-shape) Sentoki was used as a lance and Yuzetsu Sentoki (points with projection) was used as a dart.
Konohagata (a leaf-shape) Sentoki was used as a lance and Yuzetsu Sentoki (points with projection) was used as a dart.

sen.j: 前者の方は、長さ・重さの変化の幅が大きい。
sen.e: Length and weight of Konohagata Sentoki vary greatly.
Length and weight of the former Sentoki vary greatly.
Length and weight of the former Sentoki vary greatly.

sen.j: 後者の方はその幅が小さい。
sen.e: Length and weight of Yuzetsu Sentoki were uniform.
Length and weight of the latter Sentoki were uniform.
Length and weight of the latter Sentoki were uniform.

sen.j: 縄文時代の鏃は、厚みが薄く、三角形である。
sen.e: Yajiri (arrowheads) of the Jomon Period were thin and triangular-shaped.
Yajiri (arrowheads) of the Jomon period were thin and triangular-shaped.
Yajiri (arrowheads) of the Jomon period were thin and triangular-shaped.

sen.j: それに比べ、弥生時代中頃の近畿地方の鏃は分厚くて重く、中には三角形のものもあるが、大多数は木の葉型である。
sen.e: On the other hand, arrowheads of the mid-Yayoi Period in the Kinki region were made to be thick and heavy and most were leaf-shaped while some were triangular-shaped.
On the other hand, arrowheads of the mid-Yayoi period in the Kinki region were made to be thick and heavy and most were leaf-shaped while some were triangular-shaped.
On the other hand, arrowheads of the mid-Yayoi period in the Kinki region were made to be thick and heavy and most were leaf-shaped while some were triangular-shaped.

sen.j: 重さは、鉄や青銅の鏃に匹敵するという。
sen.e: Their weights were equivalent to the weight of the arrowheads made from iron or bronze.
Their weights were equivalent to the weight of the arrowheads made from iron or bronze.
Their weights were equivalent to the weight of the arrowheads made from iron or bronze.

sen.j: 重いほど打撃力が増す。
sen.e: The heavier the arrowheads were, the more damage they caused.
The heavier the arrowheads became, the more damage they caused.
The heavier the arrowheads became, the more damage they caused.

sen.j: 縄文時代にはシカやイノシシを獲るには軽く、速く、遠くへ飛ぶ鏃で充分有効であった。
sen.e: Arrowheads of the early Jomon Period were made light, so they were able to fly fast and far to effectively hunt deer and wild boar.
Arrowheads of the early Jomon period were made light, so they were able to fly fast and far to hunt deer and wild boar effectively.
Arrowheads of the early Jomon period were made light, so they were able to fly fast and far to hunt deer and wild boar effectively.

sen.j: しかし、弥生時代に入っても初めのうちは軽い鏃を使っていたが、紀元前1世紀から1世紀ごろの近畿地方から香川県にかけて形が大きく重さも重くなり、深く突き刺さる鏃が現れるようになった。
sen.e: Light weight arrowheads were used until beginning of the Yayoi Period; however, the bigger and heavier arrowheads which could penetrate deeper started to be used in the Kinki region between the first century B.C. and the first century A.D.

Light weight arrowheads were used until beginning of the Yayoi period; however, the bigger and heavier arrowheads which could penetrate deeper started to be used in the Kinki region between the first century before Christ and the first century of the Christian era.

Light weight arrowheads were used until beginning of the Yayoi period; however, the bigger and heavier arrowheads which could penetrate deeper started to be used in the Kinki region between the first century before Christ and the first century of the Christian era.

sen.j: つまり、武器としての使用も増えた。
sen.e: In other words, the use of the arrowhead as weapons increased.
In other words, the use of the arrowhead as weapons increased.
In other words, the use of the arrowhead as weapons increased.

sen.j: 石鏃は、縄文の初めから弥生前期まで一貫して大多数が2グラム未満、1～3センチメートルの範囲に収まっている。
sen.e: The majority of Sekizoku weighed less than two grams and were between one and three centimeters in size throughout the time until the beginning of the Jomon era to the beginning of the Yayoi Period.

The majority of Sekizoku weighed less than two grams and was between one and three centimeters in size throughout the time until the beginning of the Jomon period to the beginning of the Yayoi period.

The majority of Sekizoku weighed less than two grams and was between one and three centimeters in size throughout the time until the beginning of the Jomon period to the beginning of the Yayoi period.

sen.j: このことから、長期にわたって狩猟具が、特に大きな変化がなかったといえる。
sen.e: These findings revealed that there were no major changes in the overall design of hunting equipment for a long period of time.
These findings revealed that there were no major changes in the overall design of hunting equipment for a long period of time.
These findings revealed that there were no major changes in the overall design of hunting equipment for a long period of time.

sen.j: それが突如として弥生中期に、深く突き刺さりやすい形の石鏃が高地性集落の出現とともに近畿地方に出現し、大量に出土している。
sen.e: Sekizoku, which was easy to penetrate deeper, suddenly appeared in the Kinki region during the Yayoi Period as Upland Settlements were built and many of such Sekizoku have been unearthed.
Sekizoku, which was easy to penetrate deeper, suddenly appeared in the Kinki region during the Yayoi period as upland settlements were built and many of such Sekizoku have been unearthed.
Sekizoku, which was easy to penetrate deeper, suddenly appeared in the Kinki region during the Yayoi period as upland settlements were built and many of such Sekizoku have been unearthed.

sen.j: このような状況からみて、狩猟具が武器に変質したと考えられる。
sen.e: It is thought from these circumstances that tools for hunting became weapons.
It is thought from these circumstances that tools for hunting became weapons.
It is thought from these circumstances that tools for hunting became weapons.

sen.j: 吉野ヶ里遺跡で発掘された甕棺の中から多くの鏃が突き刺さった一体の人骨が見つかっている。
sen.e: Human skeleton containing embedded arrowheads were found inside the Kamekan (an earthware jar-coffin) in the Yosginogari ruin.
A human skeleton embedded many arrowheads were found inside the Kamekan (an earthenware jar-coffin) in the Yoshinogari Ruins.
sen.cmt: スペル、用語を変更しました。
sen.e: A human skeleton embedded many arrowheads were found inside the Kamekan (an earthenware jar-coffin) in the Yoshinogari Ruins.

sen.j: それらの鏃は、部分的に磨いた石鏃、打製の石鏃、サメの牙で造った鏃などが10本刺さっていた。
sen.e: Ten arrowheads made from either partially grinded stone, chipped stones, or shark teeth were embedded in the skeleton.
10 arrowheads made from partially grinded stone, chipped stones, or shark teeth were embedded in the skeleton.
10 arrowheads made from partially grinded stone, chipped stones, or shark teeth were embedded in the skeleton.

sen.j: 材料は黒曜石や粘板岩、頁岩が多い。
sen.e: Sekizoku were mainly made from obsidian, slate, or shale.
Sekizoku were mainly made of obsidian, slate, or shale.
Sekizoku were mainly made of obsidian, slate, or shale.

sen.j: 剥片石器に属する。
sen.e: Sekizoku belongs to the Hakuhen-sekki Stone tool.
Sekizoku belongs to flake stone tools.
Sekizoku belongs to flake stone tools.

sen.j: 写真は突起をともなわない石鏃（無茎石鏃）であるが、矢の先端の反対側に突起（茎）をもつものもあり、これは有茎石鏃と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Picture shows a Sekizoku without a projection (Mukei Sekizoku), although there are Sekizoku that have a projection opposite the pointed top of an arrowhead and these are called Yukei Sekizoku.

Picture shows a Sekizoku without a projection (Mukei Sekizoku), although there are Sekizoku that have a projection opposite the pointed top of an arrowhead and these are called Yukei Sekizoku (Sekizoku with projection).

Picture shows a Sekizoku without a projection (Mukei Sekizoku), although there are Sekizoku that have a projection opposite the pointed top of an arrowhead and these are called Yukei Sekizoku (Sekizoku with projection).

sen.j: 縄文時代では、原石を打ち欠いて剥片をつくり、それに細部の調整を加えて製作した。
sen.e: Sekizoku during the Jomon Period was produced by chipping an ore followed by shapening it to the form of Sekizoku.
Sekizoku during the Jomon period was produced by chipping an ore followed by sharpening it to the form of Sekizoku.
Sekizoku during the Jomon period was produced by chipping an ore followed by sharpening it to the form of Sekizoku.

sen.j: ほとんどが打製石器に属する。
sen.e: The majority of Sekizoku belongs to the Dasei-sekki.
The majority of Sekizoku belongs to chipped stone tools.
The majority of Sekizoku belongs to chipped stone tools.

sen.j: 弥生時代以降から側縁に磨きをかけた磨製石器としての石鏃が増える。
sen.e: The production of Masei-sekki that involved the method of grinding the side of Sekizoku increased after the Yayoi Period.
The production of ground stone tools that involved the method of grinding the side of Sekizoku increased after the Yayoi period.
The production of ground stone tools that involved the method of grinding the side of Sekizoku increased after the Yayoi period.

tit.e: Attachment of Sekizoku to the shaft
Attachment of Sekizoku to the shaft
Attachment of Sekizoku to the shaft

sen.j: 矢柄（やがら）への取り付けは、管状の植物の凹み部分などを利用し、ヒモなどで縛ったものであろうと考えられる。
sen.e: It is thought that Sekizoku was attached to the shaft by tying it to tubulous plants in its hollow areas using string.
It is thought that Sekizoku was attached to the shaft by tying it to tubulous plants in its hollow areas using string.
It is thought that Sekizoku was attached to the shaft by tying it to tubulous plants in its hollow areas using string.

sen.j: 有茎石鏃の場合は、突起部分を凹み部分とかみあわせて強度を増したものであろう。
sen.e: For Yukei Sekizoku, it is thought that the projection was attached to the 凹 area to increase the strength.
For Yukei Sekizoku, it is thought that the projection was attached to the depression area to increase the strength.
For Yukei Sekizoku, it is thought that the projection was attached to the depression area to increase the strength.

sen.j: なお、東北・北海道地方では、石鏃からアスファルトが検出される場合も多く、秋田県の油田から湧出する天然アスファルトが交易の結果、北日本一帯に流通していたことが判明している。
sen.e: Moreover, asphalt was often detected on Sekizoku pieces found in the Tohoku and Hokkaido regions; thus, natural asphalt from oil mines in the Akita prefecture is thought to be distributed throughout northern Japan by trade.

Moreover, asphalt was often detected on Sekizoku pieces found in the Tohoku and Hokkaido regions; thus, natural asphalt from oil mines in the Akita Prefecture is thought to be distributed throughout northern Japan by trade.

Moreover, asphalt was often detected on Sekizoku pieces found in the Tohoku and Hokkaido regions; thus, natural asphalt from oil mines in the Akita Prefecture is thought to be distributed throughout northern Japan by trade.

sen.j: 石鏃を漁猟具として使用した例もある。
sen.e: There is evidence that Sekizoku was used as a fishing tool.
There is evidence that Sekizoku was used as a fishing tool.
There is evidence that Sekizoku was used as a fishing tool.

sen.j: その場合は、骨角器である回転式離頭銛の先端に付けたものと考えられている。
sen.e: Sekizoku was thought to be attached to the top part of a rotary-type separation head harpoon (a bone tool) when it was used as a fishing tool.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sekizoku is thought to be attached to the top part of a rotary-type separation head harpoon (a bone tool) when it was used as a fishing tool.
Sekizoku is thought to be attached to the top part of a rotary-type separation head harpoon (a bone tool) when it was used as a fishing tool.

sen.j: しかし、沿岸部ではまれに有茎石鏃に似ているが基部（茎の部分）が太く、粗いつくりの打製石器が出土することがある。
sen.e: However, chipped stone tools similar to Yukei Sekki, excluding its thick base (projected area) and poor construction, were seldomly excavated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, chipped stone tools similar to Yukei Sekizoku, excluding its thick base (projected part) and poor construction, were seldom excavated.
However, chipped stone tools similar to Yukei Sekizoku, excluding its thick base (projected part) and poor construction, were seldom excavated.

sen.j: これは石鏃と区別して石銛と呼んでいる。
sen.e: These were called Sekisen differentiated from Sekizoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These are called Sekisen differentiated from Sekizoku.
These are called Sekisen differentiated from Sekizoku.

sen.j: 石銛は出土量そのものが乏しいので、使用法も含めて解明されていない部分が多い。
sen.e: Sekisen were rarely found; therefore, many of its details including it's usage, were not clear.
Sekisen are rarely found; therefore, many of its details including the usage, are not clear.
Sekisen are rarely found; therefore, many of its details including the usage, are not clear.
